data.selected_cameras: Enable these cameras for AI analysis

voice_aliases.title: Voice Aliases
voice_aliases.description:
Map simple voice names to cameras. One per line: alias:camera.entity_id

Example:
backyard:camera.backyard_fluent
front porch:camera.front_porch
driveway:camera.driveway_cam

Your cameras:
{available_cameras}

facial_recognition.title: Facial Recognition
facial_recognition.description: LLM-based facial recognition. Store reference photos in subfolders per person (e.g., /config/camera_faces/Carlos/).

camera_context.title: Camera Context
camera_context.description:
Select a camera to add or edit its context. Context helps the AI give more natural, personalized descriptions.

{context_count} of {camera_count} cameras have context configured.

camera_context_edit.title: Edit Context: {camera_name}
camera_context_edit.description:
Add context about this camera's view ({entity_id}).

The AI will use this to describe scenes naturally, like 'the neighbor is washing their car' instead of 'a person is near a vehicle'.

Example context:
This camera faces the street
The house across the street belongs to the Johnsons
Their silver Ford F-150 is usually in their driveway

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.description: Store camera analysis events in a calendar for historical tracking. View in the Calendar panel or add a calendar card to your dashboard.
